name: Accessibility Camp - NYC
body:
# Accessibility Camp - New York City ## Event Information Thanks for visiting the home of the first Accessibility Camp New York City Area. The event will be hosted by NYU MAGNET2 Metrotech Center (Brooklyn, NY 11201) on Saturday September 26, 2015. Please plan to arrive at 9:30 to register. We will start promptly at 10:00 AM and end at 4:30 PM. The goal of the day is to provide an open, informal space for conversation and networking around digital access and inclusion. Focusing on users with different disabilities, sessions can cover digital accessibility topics from the web (technical to tactical), desktop software, mobile apps, eLearning, online gaming, open source innovations, and everything in between. Watch this brief video from the first Accessibility Camp Toronto to get a feel for what to expect during the day. Regardless of your level of knowledge, this event is for you. It will be a great opportunity for members of the design/development, usability, accessibility, other IT and end-users with disabilities communities to interact and learn from each other. We recommend you browse the Frequently Asked Questions, especially if you have never attended a participant-driven BarCamp/unconference before. Please follow event updates on Twitter via [a11ynyc](http://twitter.com/@a11ynyc).

About Accessibility Camps

Accessibility Camp Bay Area takes its inspiration from the first Accessibility Camp DC, which was held in October 2009. Sister events include:
  • Accessibility Camp Toronto
  • Accessibility Camp Los Angeles
  • Boston Accessibility Conference
  • Accessibility Camp Guelph
  • Accessibility Camp Seattle
  • Accessibility Camp Tokyo
Learn more about the Accessibility Camp Movement

Get Involved!

  • Would you like to present on a digital accessibility topic?
  • Interested in stepping up as an event sponsor (e.g., to help pay for disability-related accommodations, the event after-party)?
  • Have a general question about the event?
  • Want to be updated by e-mail as the event takes shape?
Follow event updates on Twitter via @a11ynyc
